page.title: 15Coast - The Caves
page.content: The name Wemyss is derived from the Celtic 'uaimh' which means cave. There were once eleven caves near the shore of East Wemyss but this number has been reduced to nine because of earth movements and mining operations. The caves are : 1 Gasworks Cave - can go in. 2 White Cove Cave - closed. 3 Sloping Cave - DANGEROUS. 4 Jonathan's Cave - can go in. 5 Un-named Cave - DANGEROUS. 6 Well Cave - DANGEROUS. 7 East Doo Cave - closed. 8 West Doo Cave - can go in. 9 Court Cave - DANGEROUS. 10 Michael Cave - covered up. 11 Glass Cave - filled in. The rocks in which the caves are to be found are a particularly soft variety of Red Sandstone. The sea was at least 8m higher when the caves were formed.
